title: Henrietta Garnett, scion of the Bloomsbury set who overcame a troubled childhood to become an acclaimed biographer – obituary
text:
Henrietta Garnett, who has died of cancer aged 74, was a third-generation product of Bloomsbury, and as the daughter of Angelica and David Garnett inherited a complex legacy of interlocking sexual and artistic relationships.

Her life, like that of her three sisters, was marked by unresolved conflicts arising from their family’s emotional heritage. Yet after love affairs, marriages, an attempted suicide and years of nomadic wandering, Henrietta eventually found her feet as a biographer.

Henrietta Catherine Garnett was born on May 15 1945, the second of her parents’ four daughters. Her mother, Angelica, the daughter of the artist Vanessa Bell and niece of Virginia Woolf, believed her father to...
description: Henrietta Garnett, who has died of cancer aged 74, was a third-generation product of Bloomsbury, and as the daughter of Angelica and David Garnett inherited a complex legacy of interlocking sexual and artistic relationships.
